page.title: 15VILLAGE HALL,SPARSHOLT.
page.content: The new hall is being built on the same site as the old hall,which was originally used as an army hut in Twyford Camp during the 1st World War(1914_1918).This hall was built of wood and was in poor condition and not big enough for modern events like disco's,badminton and volleyball. The new hall building was started on the 16th April 1985 and will be finished on 14th october 1985.The money was raised by Sparsholt Village Hall Committee,the Parish Council and the Education Authority.The total cost is Â£100,000. The materials used are:_ 31,000 facing bricks,500 square metres of face blocks,40 square metres of concrete and 7,000 tiles. This hall will be used for clubs and societies to meet and different forms of entertainment to take place in.
